title: Virtual Member Lecture: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
title_display: Virtual Member Lecture: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
hero_caption: Stela of Amenemhat and Hemet, Middle Kingdom, early Dynasty 12, about 1956–1877 BCE. Ancient Egyptian; Probably Thebes (now Luxor), Egypt. Museum Purchase Fund.
short_description: Join Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian Art, for this member lecture on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works. She will share how objects in the museum's collection figured into ancient Egyptian life and practices related to death and the afterlife.
list_description: Hear from curator Ashley Arico on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works.
description:
Join Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian Art, for this member lecture on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works. She will share how objects in the museum's collection figured into ancient Egyptian life and practices related to death and the afterlife.

Please note that all event times listed are in central time.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
